info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 3:47PM EDT until July 01 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Rockingham County in western Virginia... Northeastern Pendleton County in eastern West Virginia... South central Grant County in eastern West Virginia... Southwestern Hardy County in eastern West Virginia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 347 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Upper Tract, or 9 miles southwest of Rough Run, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Upper Tract, Bergton, Ruddle, Milam, Brushy Run, Deer Run, Brake and Criders. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
